intro: Lupinus perennis f. bicolor, commonly known as the blue and white lupine, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking blue and white flower spikes. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in prairie habitats. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
